moves.1. e4: This is another game I had with the lovely MissLoly.
moves.1... c5: I played e5 in our previous game, so I do somethng different.
moves.2. Bc4: A good move, developing a piece to a good square and striking at f7.
moves.2... e6: So I blunt the power of that bishop.
moves.3. Nf3: Another good move, developing a piece.
moves.3... a6: So I "threaten" a queen side pawn expansion, but she can just ignore it, like she did.
moves.6. Nc3: This protects the pawn, but d3 was a much better way of protecting it, as I can just drive the knight away.
moves.7... Bxe4: And i take, to go a clear pawn up.
moves.8. Nxc5: This is another bad mistake, just giving up a knight.
moves.10. d4: And now she attacks the other bishop.
moves.11. c4: She continues with her policy of attacking my bishops.
Luckily I can take that pawn en passant.
moves.12... Qc7: I prevent her from continuing her plan with c3-c4. Now, because of this queen move, if she does play c3-c4 then I can just take that pawn with my bishop, and if the then plays Qc2 pinning my bishop I can protect it with d7-d5. I am also attacking c3.
moves.13. Ne5: This is another mistake, c3 needed protecting.
moves.13... d6: So I drive the knight back first.
moves.14... Qxc3: I take, attacking d4 and Ra1.
moves.15. Bd2: This saves the rook, but not the pawn.
moves.17. Qc1: Post Match Computer Analysis (PMGA) gives 17. Nb4 as better, but this move is interesting, with potential attacks along the c file.
moves.17... e5: PGMA gives this as a mistake. I will explain why I played it. I want to play Qg6 to threaten mate on g2. But if I play it immediately, she can play Nf4, so e5 was to stop Nf4.
moves.18. Bg5: She attacks my queen. I have to be very careful here! Qg6?? is met by Qc8 mate!
moves.18... Qf5: The queen on this square covers c8.
moves.19... Nc6: I want to play Qe4, but if I play it, she still has Qc8 mate - so I block that mate first.
moves.20. g4: A dreadful move, opening up he own king side position.
moves.20... Qe4: Mate on g2 or h1 can't be prevented.
moves.21... Qg2#: And it is all over. Many thanks for reading this dear reader. Please leave a comment or two and rate this annotation on the star system, many thanks!
